alert.note: Alert for Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued October 19 at 4:00AM HST until October 19 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI AND NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY CANCELLED FOR WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... .Surf along north and west facing shores will steadily lower through the day as a north-northwest swell (330-340 degrees) eases. Heights should dip below the advisory levels by Friday, then continue to lower into the weekend as the swell moves out. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Surf of 12 to 16 feet lowering to 10 to 15 feet this afternoon along north facing shores. Surf of 8 to 12 feet along west facing shores. * WHERE...North and west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu, Molokai, and north facing shores of Maui. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST this evening. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous.
info.instruction: Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.
